articles.headline: G.O.P. Claims Victory as Bill to Curb Flight Delays Passes
articles.snippet: President Obama and Congressional Democrats on Friday abandoned their once-firm stand that airport bottlenecks would be addressed only in a broader fix to across-the-board cuts.
articles.abstract: President Obama and Congressional Democrats on Friday abandoned their once-firm stand that airport bottlenecks would be addressed only in a broader fix to across-the-board cuts.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama and Congressional Democrats on Friday abandoned their once-firm stand that growing airport bottlenecks would be addressed only in a broader fix to across-the-board spending cuts, accepting bipartisan legislation that would bring the nation’s air traffic control system back up to full strength.

articles.headline: Obama Not Rushing to Act on Signs Syria Used Chemical Arms
articles.snippet: The president said he would respond “prudently” and “deliberately” to evidence that Syria has used chemical weapons, tamping down any expectations that he would take swift action.
articles.abstract: The president said he would respond “prudently” and “deliberately” to evidence that Syria has used chemical weapons, tamping down any expectations that he would take swift action.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama said Friday that he would respond “prudently” and “deliberately” to evidence that Syria had used chemical weapons, tamping down any expectations that he would take swift action after an American intelligence assessment that the Syrian government had used the chemical agent sarin on a small scale in the nation’s civil war.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Michael R. Gordon

articles.headline: Financial Opposites in a Life Together
articles.snippet: A couple tries to reconcile different money philosophies before opening a joint bank account to handle household expenses.
articles.abstract: A couple tries to reconcile different money philosophies before opening a joint bank account to handle household expenses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jennifer and Scott Bartone were married in October after a seven-year courtship. But they did not have a serious conversation about money until this week.

articles.headline: Dutch Man Said to Be Held in Powerful Internet Attack
articles.snippet: Dutch authorities said the Spanish police arrested a man in connection with an assault on a spam-fighting site that caused widespread Internet congestion.
articles.abstract: Dutch authorities said the Spanish police arrested a man in connection with an assault on a spam-fighting site that caused widespread Internet congestion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dutch authorities say police officials in Spain have arrested a man believed to be connected to an online attack on a spam-fighting site that snarled the Internet last month.

articles.headline: Europe Facing More Pressure to Reconsider Cuts as a Cure
articles.snippet: European officials who favored austerity have adopted a softer tone, backing away from a strategy that is widely unpopular with the public.
articles.abstract: European officials who favored austerity have adopted a softer tone, backing away from a strategy that is widely unpopular with the public.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Unemployment has surpassed Great Depression-era levels in Southern Europe. Recession is drifting to the once resilient economies of the north. Even some onetime hawks on government spending say they cannot cut any more.

articles.headline: Internet Sales Tax Coming Too Late for Some Stores
articles.snippet: Congress is considering taxing sales made by Internet retailers like Amazon, but some sellers believe it should have been done years ago.
articles.abstract: Congress is considering taxing sales made by Internet retailers like Amazon, but some sellers believe it should have been done years ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anita Demetropoulos, a Maine shopkeeper, figured she would never see the day when her most relentless competitor, Amazon, would be forced to collect sales tax.

articles.headline: In Trek North, First Lure Is Mexico’s Other Line
articles.snippet: Central Americans fleeing crime and economic stagnation are flowing freely across Mexico’s southern border and causing a spike in migration to the United States.
articles.abstract: Central Americans fleeing crime and economic stagnation are flowing freely across Mexico’s southern border and causing a spike in migration to the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: CIUDAD HIDALGO, Mexico — With her leg snapped and folded excruciatingly over her shoulder, Elvira López Hernández lay flat on a railroad bed as the freight train hurtled above her, clinging tightly to two things: the railroad ties beneath her and the memory of the 4-year-old daughter she had left behind in Guatemala.

articles.headline: Islamist Rebels Create Dilemma on Syria Policy
articles.snippet: The armed opposition fighting President Bashar al-Assad’s government has become radicalized, leaving the United States with no obvious allies.
articles.abstract: The armed opposition fighting President Bashar al-Assad’s government has become radicalized, leaving the United States with no obvious allies.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — In Syria’s largest city, Aleppo, rebels aligned with Al Qaeda control the power plant, run the bakeries and head a court that applies Islamic law. Elsewhere, they have seized government oil fields, put employees back to work and now profit from the crude they produce.

articles.headline: A Battered Dream, Then a Violent Path
articles.snippet: Tamerlan Tsarnaev, a winner of Golden Gloves titles, was barred from a national boxing tournament because he was not a United States citizen.
articles.abstract: Tamerlan Tsarnaev, a winner of Golden Gloves titles, was barred from a national boxing tournament because he was not a United States citizen.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — It was a blow the immigrant boxer could not withstand: after capturing his second consecutive title as the Golden Gloves heavyweight champion of New England in 2010, Tamerlan Anzorovich Tsarnaev, 23, was barred from the national Tournament of Champions because he was not a United States citizen.
articles.byline: By Deborah Sontag, David M. Herszenhorn and Serge F. Kovaleski

articles.headline: Trying to Slam the Bailout Door
articles.snippet: Two senators know they’ll have to fight big banks to achieve passage of a bill to protect taxpayers from future bailouts.
articles.abstract: Two senators know they’ll have to fight big banks to achieve passage of a bill to protect taxpayers from future bailouts.
articles.lead_paragraph: THERE’S a lot to like, if you’re a taxpayer, in the new bipartisan bill from two concerned senators hoping to end the peril of big bank bailouts. But if you’re a large and powerful financial institution that’s too big to fail, you won’t like this bill one bit.

articles.headline: How Big Data Is Playing Recruiter for Specialized Workers
articles.snippet: In industries where good talent can be hard to find, companies are using algorithms to scour the Web for recruits, and in the process, they are challenging some traditional notions of hiring.
articles.abstract: In industries where good talent can be hard to find, companies are using algorithms to scour the Web for recruits, and in the process, they are challenging some traditional notions of hiring.
articles.lead_paragraph: WHEN the e-mail came out of the blue last summer, offering a shot as a programmer at a San Francisco start-up, Jade Dominguez, 26, was living off credit card debt in a rental in South Pasadena, Calif., while he taught himself programming. He had been an average student in high school and hadn’t bothered with college, but someone, somewhere out there in the cloud, thought that he might be brilliant, or at least a diamond in the rough.

articles.headline: Where the Artists Are the Superheroes
articles.snippet: In the fast-paced world of video games, Ubisoft’s Montreal studio has aimed to maintain an old-fashioned attention to artistic detail.
articles.abstract: In the fast-paced world of video games, Ubisoft’s Montreal studio has aimed to maintain an old-fashioned attention to artistic detail.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Tchae Measroch leaves work, his hands usually bear a fresh cut or bruise. He works, often on his knees, in a small room crowded with an odd mix of items: a dried-grass hula skirt, a car door, baseball bats, swords and knives of varying length, a camouflage net typically used to disguise military equipment from enemy eyes.

articles.headline: Loans Borrowed Against Pensions Squeeze Retirees
articles.snippet: Pension advances, federal and state authorities say, are carefully disguised loans that carry interest rates that are often many times higher than those on credit cards.
articles.abstract: Pension advances, federal and state authorities say, are carefully disguised loans that carry interest rates that are often many times higher than those on credit cards.
articles.lead_paragraph: To retirees, the offers can sound like the answer to every money worry: convert tomorrow’s pension checks into today’s hard cash.

articles.headline: Disruptions: Brain Computer Interfaces Inch Closer to Mainstream
articles.snippet: Soon, we could be turning on the lights at home just by thinking about it, or sending an e-mail from our smartphone without even pulling the device from our pocket.
articles.abstract: Soon, we could be turning on the lights at home just by thinking about it, or sending an e-mail from our smartphone without even pulling the device from our pocket.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last week, engineers sniffing around the programming code for Google Glass found hidden examples of ways that people might interact with the wearable computers without having to say a word. Among them, a user could nod to turn the glasses on or off. A single wink might tell the glasses to take a picture.

articles.headline: Wealth Gap      Among Races     Has Widened Since     Recession
articles.snippet: The wealth gap might still be growing, experts said, further dimming the prospects for economic advancement for current and future generations of nonwhite Americans.
articles.abstract: The wealth gap might still be growing, experts said, further dimming the prospects for economic advancement for current and future generations of nonwhite Americans.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Millions of Americans suffered a loss of wealth during the recession and the sluggish recovery that followed. But the last half-decade has proved far worse for black and Hispanic families than for white families, starkly widening the already large gulf in wealth between non-Hispanic white Americans and most minority groups, according to a new study from the Urban Institute.

articles.headline: Bombings Trip Up Reddit in Its Turn in Spotlight
articles.snippet: While Reddit has never pretended to be a news organization, as it grows bigger and more influential, the rest of the world expects it to exercise judgment.
articles.abstract: While Reddit has never pretended to be a news organization, as it grows bigger and more influential, the rest of the world expects it to exercise judgment.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the days after the Boston Marathon bombings, the social media and entertainment site Reddit had the breakout moment it had been waiting for — but not the one it expected.

articles.headline: Giving a Wide Berth to Artists of Cable TV
articles.snippet: Built on lush portraits of human pathology, subscription- and ad-supported cable channels gradually became hotbeds of quality and profits, as detailed in “Difficult Men” by Brett Martin.
articles.abstract: Built on lush portraits of human pathology, subscription- and ad-supported cable channels gradually became hotbeds of quality and profits, as detailed in “Difficult Men” by Brett Martin.
articles.lead_paragraph: We used to turn on the television to see people who were happier, funnier, prettier versions of ourselves. But at the turn of the century, something fundamental changed and we began to see scarier, crazier, darker forms of the American way of life.

articles.headline: Stormy Relationship, Forgiving Followers
articles.snippet: Despite the news media’s outrage when Chris Brown assaulted Rihanna in 2009, many Rihanna fans have forgiven the pair’s recent reconciliation.
articles.abstract: Despite the news media’s outrage when Chris Brown assaulted Rihanna in 2009, many Rihanna fans have forgiven the pair’s recent reconciliation.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Rihanna, one of the pop world’s most successful women, goes from arena to sold-out arena on her latest tour — which was to hit the Prudential Center in Newark on Sunday night and head to the Barclays Center in Brooklyn this weekend — the news media and her fans have been eager for updates on her relationship with the singer Chris Brown.

articles.headline: With Bags of Cash, C.I.A. Seeks Influence in Afghanistan
articles.snippet: Millions of dollars have flowed from the agency to President Hamid Karzai’s office, but there’s little proof that this “ghost money” has bought the influence the agency has sought.
articles.abstract: Millions of dollars have flowed from the agency to President Hamid Karzai’s office, but there’s little proof that this “ghost money” has bought the influence the agency has sought.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — For more than a decade, wads of American dollars packed into suitcases, backpacks and, on occasion, plastic shopping bags have been dropped off every month or so at the offices of Afghanistan’s president — courtesy of the Central Intelligence Agency.

articles.headline: Venture Capitalists Are Making Bigger Bets on Food Start-Ups
articles.snippet: The ultimate goal of venture capitalists in Silicon Valley, who funneled about $350 million into food projects last year, is to transform the food industry.
articles.abstract: The ultimate goal of venture capitalists in Silicon Valley, who funneled about $350 million into food projects last year, is to transform the food industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: What if the next big thing in tech does not arrive on your smartphone or in the cloud? What if it lands on your plate?
articles.byline: By Jenna Wortham and Claire Cain Miller

articles.headline: Tears and Rage as Hope Fades in Bangladesh
articles.snippet: The collapse of a building, the Rana Plaza, is considered the deadliest accident in the history of the garment industry, having claimed at least 377 lives.
articles.abstract: The collapse of a building, the Rana Plaza, is considered the deadliest accident in the history of the garment industry, having claimed at least 377 lives.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAVAR, Bangladesh — The mother stood at the edge of the wreckage, pressing her lips to photos of her two children — Asma, who had worked in a garment factory on the fourth floor, and Sultan, who worked on the fifth.

articles.headline: Two Classics of the Soaps Are Heading to the Web
articles.snippet: Two war horses of the genre, “All My Children” and “One Life to Live,” will have their Internet premieres at 5 a.m. Monday on Hulu and iTunes.
articles.abstract: Two war horses of the genre, “All My Children” and “One Life to Live,” will have their Internet premieres at 5 a.m. Monday on Hulu and iTunes.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Monday the soap operas “All My Children” and “One Life to Live” will start their second lives, and Jeffrey Kwatinetz and Rich Frank will start to find out if they’re right.

articles.headline: A Drug War Informer in No Man’s Land
articles.snippet: Luis Octavio López Vega, a former adviser to a Mexican drug czar and a D.E.A. informant, has been in hiding as Mexican officials seek his arrest and American officials have cut ties with him.
articles.abstract: Luis Octavio López Vega, a former adviser to a Mexican drug czar and a D.E.A. informant, has been in hiding as Mexican officials seek his arrest and American officials have cut ties with him.
articles.lead_paragraph: The forecast called for record snowstorms, and Luis Octavio López Vega had no heat in his small hide-out.

articles.headline: Twitter Speaks, Markets Listen and Fears Rise
articles.snippet: After a Twitter hoax caused the Dow to drop temporarily by 150 points, regulators are increasingly concerned about the combination of social media and high-frequency trading.
articles.abstract: After a Twitter hoax caused the Dow to drop temporarily by 150 points, regulators are increasingly concerned about the combination of social media and high-frequency trading.
articles.lead_paragraph: Could the global economy hinge on 140 characters?
articles.byline: By Amy Chozick and Nicole Perlroth

articles.headline: Push to Require Online Sales Tax Divides the G.O.P.
articles.snippet: Antitax groups seem to be losing their influence, as Republican lawmakers’ constituents support legislation that would require Internet retailers to collect sales taxes.
articles.abstract: Antitax groups seem to be losing their influence, as Republican lawmakers’ constituents support legislation that would require Internet retailers to collect sales taxes.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Legislation that would force Internet retailers to collect sales taxes from their customers has put antitax and small-government activists like Grover Norquist’s Americans for Tax Reform and the Heritage Foundation in an unusual position: they’re losing.

articles.headline: A Nasty, Epic Real Estate Battle With Stakes 102 Stories High
articles.snippet: A venomous public battle over a $5.2 billion proposal by the Empire State Building’s managing family will face a crucial legal test beginning on Monday.
articles.abstract: A venomous public battle over a $5.2 billion proposal by the Empire State Building’s managing family will face a crucial legal test beginning on Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the day it opened in 1931, the Empire State Building carved out a special place on the New York skyline, but it has also been at the center of a succession of battles for control by equally larger-than-life figures, including Donald J. Trump and Leona Helmsley.
articles.byline: By Charles V. Bagli and Julie Creswell
